node.Title: A decision model for an MCDM problem
node.Description: This is a decision for an MCDM problem that addresses...

node.Title: Functional appropriateness
node.Description: degree to which the functions facilitate the accomplishment of specified tasks and objectives

node.Title: Functional completeness
node.Description: degree to which the set of functions covers all the specified tasks and user objectives

node.Title: Functional correctness
node.Description: degree to which a product or system provides the correct results with the needed degree of precision

node.Title: Functional suitability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system provides functions that meet stated and implied needs when used under specified conditions

node.Title: Reliability
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component performs specified functions under specified conditions for a specified period

node.Title: Performance efficiency
node.Description: performance relative to the amount of resources used under stated conditions

node.Title: Usability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can be used by specified users to achieve specified goals with effectiveness, efficiency and satisfaction in a specified context of use

node.Title: Maintainability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which a product or system can be modified by the intended maintainers

node.Title: Security
node.Description: degree to which a product or system protects information and data so that persons or other products or systems have the degree of data access appropriate to their types and levels of authorization

node.Title: Compatibility
node.Description: degree to which a product, system or component can exchange information with other products, systems or components, and/or perform its required functions, while sharing the same hardware or software environment

node.Title: Portability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which a system, product or component can be transferred from one hardware, software or other operational or usage environment to another

node.Title: Supplier
node.Description: Description about anyone who provides goods or services to a company or individuals.

node.Title: Cost
node.Description: Denotes the amount of money that a company spends on the creation or production of goods or services.

node.Title: Product
node.Description: Description about any article or substance that is manufactured or refined for sale.

node.Title: Maturity
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component meets needs for reliability under normal operation

node.Title: Availability
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component is operational and accessible when required for use

node.Title: Fault tolerance
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component operates as intended despite the presence of hardware or software faults

node.Title: Recoverability
node.Description: degree to which, in the event of an interruption or a failure, a product or system can recover the data directly affected and re-establish the desired state of the system

node.Title: Time behavior
node.Description: degree to which the response and processing times and throughput rates of a product or system, when performing its functions, meet requirements

node.Title: Resource utilization
node.Description: degree to which the amounts and types of resources used by a product or system, when performing its functions, meet requirements

node.Title: Capacity
node.Description: degree to which the maximum limits of a product or system parameter meet requirements

node.Title: Appropriateness recognizability
node.Description: degree to which users can recognize whether a product or system is appropriate for their needs

node.Title: Learnability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can be used by specified users to achieve specified goals of learning to use the product or system with effectiveness, efficiency, freedom from risk and satisfaction in a specified context of use

node.Title: Operability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system has attributes that make it easy to operate and control

node.Title: User error protection
node.Description: degree to which a system protects users against making errors

node.Title: User interface aesthetics
node.Description: degree to which a user interface enables pleasing and satisfying interaction for the user

node.Title: Accessibility
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can be used by people with the widest range of characteristics and capabilities to achieve a specified goal in a specified context of use

node.Title: Modularity
node.Description: degree to which a system or computer program is composed of discrete components such that a change to one component has minimal impact on other components

node.Title: Reusability
node.Description: degree to which an asset can be used in more than one system, or in building other assets

node.Title: Analyzability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which it is possible to assess the impact on a product or system of an intended change to one or more of its parts, or to diagnose a product for deficiencies or causes of failures, or to identify parts to be modified

node.Title: Modifiability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can be effectively and efficiently modified without introducing defects or degrading existing product quality

node.Title: Testability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which test criteria can be established for a system, product or component and tests can be performed to determine whether those criteria have been met

node.Title: Confidentiality
node.Description: degree to which a product or system ensures that data are accessible only to those authorized to have access

node.Title: Integrity
node.Description: degree to which a system, product or component prevents unauthorized access to, or modification of, computer programs or data

node.Title: Non-repudiation
node.Description: degree to which actions or events can be proven to have taken place, so that the events or actions cannot be repudiated later

node.Title: Accountability
node.Description: degree to which the actions of an entity can be traced uniquely to the entity

node.Title: Authenticity
node.Description: degree to which the identity of a subject or resource can be proved to be the one claimed

node.Title: Co-existence
node.Description: degree to which a product can perform its required functions efficiently while sharing a common environment and resources with other products, without detrimental impact on any other product

node.Title: Interoperability
node.Description: degree to which two or more systems, products or components can exchange information and use the information that has been exchanged

node.Title: Adaptability
node.Description: degree to which a product or system can effectively and efficiently be adapted for different or evolving hardware, software or other operational or usage environments

node.Title: Installability
node.Description: degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which a product or system can be successfully installed and/or uninstalled in a specified environment

node.Title: Replaceability
node.Description: degree to which a product can replace another specified software product for the same purpose in the same environment

node.Title: Organizational structure
node.Description: Description of the organizational structure of the supplier company.

node.Title: Positioning and Strength
node.Description: Description of the position of the supplier company in the market.

node.Title: Reputation
node.Description: Capability of the supplier to perform similar projects based on past experiences and certifications.

node.Title: Services Offered
node.Description: Description of the services offered by the supplier.

node.Title: Support
node.Description: Description of the support mechanisms offered by the supplier.

node.Title: Licensing Schema
node.Description: Description of the COTS component licensing options.

node.Title: Licensing Costs
node.Description: Detail of the costs for the different licensing options

node.Title: Platform Cost
node.Description: Estimation of the cost for the required production platform

node.Title: Implementation Cost
node.Description: Estimation of implementation costs based on similar past experiences.

node.Title: Network Cost
node.Description: Estimation of additional cost for network operation.

node.Title: Stability
node.Description: Attributes of the product that bear on the stability of the product.

node.Title: Ownership
node.Description: Attributes in relation to the intellectual property rights.

node.Title: Deliverables
node.Description: Detail of the out of the box and post implementation deliverables.

node.Title: Parameterization / Customization
node.Description: Attributes in relation to the initial effort required for the product to operate.

node.Title: Guarantees
node.Description: Detail of the guarantees provided over the product.
